Tucson knew how to deal with followers.  If they were still in the area, a =
good sonic blast from his sonar system would surely mess up their telemetry=
 and do a number on their own gyroscopic systems.  He comes to a short halt=
, tired of being stalked, he kicks up dust around short pivoting tires with=
 a loud screech, and configures his sonar attack to be harmless to Autobt a=
nd Maximal kind but NOT harmless to Predacons or Decepticons!  

" That's i=
t, I am not going to play by the rules ANY MORE! THEY WANT TROUBLE THEY GOT=
 IT!"

He blasts the sonar attack at full pitch.

" Kup, if you pick up a s=
onar disturbance, don't worry, it's me.  It may effect your computer system=
s and I do appologize for that.  But whatever or whoever is out there isn't=
 about to get away that easy!"  

He puts himself into drive and continues =
his drive toward the Ark, blasting the attack continuously.

"They think I'=
m a pushover on wheels, they'll think twice after this, I assure you Lord E=
lder... They'll think twice."

He tries really hard to hold back a short te=
mper. Tucson knew when to play games and when it was time to get serious.  =
This was the time to get serious.

"Oh yeah, Kup, in my quarters you'll fin=
d a cross bow in my weapon chamber.  Please, have that ready for me when I =
get back and make sure to put a good amount of plasma arrows in the energiz=
er for me.  You'll find all of that near an old sun dial I was working on b=
efore I left the Ark ages ago."

He turns his attentions back to Lord Elder=
.

" Before all this happened to me, my spare time was spent restorring old=
 artifacts and weapons.  I'm hoping to go back to doing some resteration, i=
t's the only thing that quells my temper which I do admit, gets rather shor=
t in times like these.  Remind me to show you what I've done when we get ba=
ck to the Ark.  I have a small work area in my quarters where I've managed =
to restore a few small artifacts... Well including one fairly large sun dia=
l..  But most of all, I've saved and restorred ancient Autobot weaponry whi=
ch may still prove useful to us now.  I have a feeling we might just need i=
t."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wro=
te:
>
> The trip back is mildly uneventful. The day moved forward as the su=
n
> slid from its mid point position to a one significantly lower in the
> =
skies. Occasionally in the distance a large dinosaur could be seen,
> from =
a predator who glanced in the direction of Lord Elder and Tuscon,
> but who=
 realized quickly that this metal machine was definitely not
> prey; to a s=
auropod, who's small head on a long neck  turned to look
> at the vehicle p=
assed by, and even the smaller variety of creatures,
> from scavengers to p=
redator, ones who typically scattered as the
> vehicle that was Tuscon boun=
ced and yet moved easily across the broken
> terrain.
> 
> Up ahead the tre=
es, which had been near constant companions during
> most of their trip beg=
an to break away as they came into more open
> country. Up ahead the beginn=
ings of a mountain range could be seen.
> Above them a flock of what could =
almost look like birds flew, although
> instead of possessing feathers, the=
y had large leathery and larger
> bodies.
> 
> "We're almost back" Lord Eld=
er said. He had been silent through most
> of the trip, his face wearing a =
thoughtful look. "There, that mountain
> over there, at the base of it."
> =

> "I'll activate the door in the shield for us." Elder said as he was
> ab=
out to open a communication signal to the Ark. However Elder paused
> and l=
ook around, as if looking for something. "Something's wrong here
> . . . " =
he said as he continued to look.
> 
> Above them the prehistoric avians tur=
ned almost as one, their calls
> almost defiant as they moved swiftly in th=
e direction that Tuscon and
> Elder had come from. "It's like we're being w=
atched."
